message.raw:
Created the RCP package, containing the moduleserver module. This is just a short script that takes a module name and port number as an argument. The script starts an XML RCP server which serves all the functions in that module, on the given port.
For example
python -m RCP.moduleserver spinapi 8000
will serve all the functions in the spinapi module on port 8000.
message.html:
Created the RCP package, containing the moduleserver module. This is just a short script that takes a module name and port number as an argument. The script starts an XML RCP server which serves all the functions in that module, on the given port.
For example
python -m RCP.moduleserver spinapi 8000
will serve all the functions in the spinapi module on port 8000.

message.raw:
Moved resample extension into a sub-package that loads the correct extension
for the platform.

Support for other platforms can be added by running the setup script in the
resample folder and moving the resulting file into an appropriately named
subdirectory with an empty __init__.py
message.html:
Moved resample extension into a sub-package that loads the correct extension
for the platform.

Support for other platforms can be added by running the setup script in the
resample folder and moving the resulting file into an appropriately named
subdirectory with an empty init.py

message.raw:
Renamed main.pyw to __main__.py, it can now be launched with:

pythonw -m runviewer.

Added a shortcut pointing to this

Made into a package with an __init__.py, added the capability for multiple
platforms to be supported. Setup.py creates an extension file named specifically
for the current platform, and __init__.py renames whichever extension file is
the right one for its bit-count to simply resample.pyd (win) or
resample.so (linux). Win 32 and 64 are included at the moment.
__init__.py will also call setup.py if the extenstions aren't compiled.

message.raw:
Fixed performance issue by not naming plot widgets.

As far as I can see, this name is only used to link axes together, and since we already link the x-axis I don't see this is a problem (I can't currently see any reason to want to link y-axes, but if anyone does, they can file a feature request!)
message.html:
Fixed performance issue by not naming plot widgets.

As far as I can see, this name is only used to link axes together, and since we already link the x-axis I don't see this is a problem (I can't currently see any reason to want to link y-axes, but if anyone does, they can file a feature request!)

As far as I can see, this name is only used to link axes together, and since we already link the x-axis I don't see this is a problem (I can't currently see any reason to want to link y-axes, but if anyone does, they can file a feature request!)

message.raw:
Speed improvements

* Updated runviewer to default to not showing any plots.
* Resampling now only occurs on channels visible

Still a performance issue with pyqtgraph. Specifically, in pyqtgraph\graphicsItems\ViewBox\ViewBoxMenu.py inside method ViewBoxMenu.setViewList() there is a performance issue when adding the name of each graph to a QComboBox one at a time. Instead you should use QComboBox.addItems() to add all the names at once. I will contact the developer soon to suggest he patches it!
message.html:
Speed improvements

  • Updated runviewer to default to not showing any plots.
  • Resampling now only occurs on channels visible

Still a performance issue with pyqtgraph. Specifically, in pyqtgraph\graphicsItems\ViewBox\ViewBoxMenu.py inside method ViewBoxMenu.setViewList() there is a performance issue when adding the name of each graph to a QComboBox one at a time. Instead you should use QComboBox.addItems() to add all the names at once. I will contact the developer soon to suggest he patches it!

Speed improvements

  • Updated runviewer to default to not showing any plots.
  • Resampling now only occurs on channels visible

Still a performance issue with pyqtgraph. Specifically, in pyqtgraph\graphicsItems\ViewBox\ViewBoxMenu.py inside method ViewBoxMenu.setViewList() there is a performance issue when adding the name of each graph to a QComboBox one at a time. Instead you should use QComboBox.addItems() to add all the names at once. I will contact the developer soon to suggest he patches it!

values.message:
Speed improvements

* Updated runviewer to default to not showing any plots.
* Resampling now only occurs on channels visible

Still a performance issue with pyqtgraph. Specifically, in pyqtgraph\graphicsItems\ViewBox\ViewBoxMenu.py inside method ViewBoxMenu.setViewList() there is a performance issue when adding the name of each graph to a QComboBox one at a time. Instead you should use QComboBox.addItems() to add all the names at once. I will contact the developer soon to suggest he patches it!

message.raw:
Many improements to runviewer

Runviewer improvements:
 * Newly added channels appended to treeview in alphabetical order
 * Add empty datasets to initial plots, So that we don't plot massive amounts of data just before the resampling occurs.
 * Fixed issues where resample time range was in pixels, not in time units
 * modified resampling algorithm to have additional points for max/min feature. Number of time points should be one more than a multiple of three (one point for current value, one point for min, one point for max...repeated + final point).
 * Modified shot class to support caching of data better
 * Modified shot class to walk the connection table starting from the master pseudoclock (currently only parses the masterpseudoclock and direct output channels on the master pseudoclock)

Modified the resampling algorithm:
 * Resampling algorithm uses float64 (double) for added precision
 * Resampling algorithm should preserve features on both sides of sample points
 * Added Python version of resamling algorithm (__resample4 in main.pyw)

Added setup.py file to build c extension

* Modified shot class to support caching of data better
* Modified shot class to walk the connection table starting from the master pseudoclock (currently only parses the masterpseudoclock and direct output channels on the master pseudoclock)

summary.html:
Many improements to runviewer

Runviewer improvements:
* Newly added channels appended to treeview in alphabetical order
* Add empty datasets to initial plots, So that we don't plot massive amounts of data just before the resampling occurs.
* Fixed issues where resample time range was in pixels, not in time units
* modified resampling algorithm to have additional points for max/min feature. Number of time points should be one more than a multiple of three (one point for current value, one point for min, one point for max...repeated + final point).
* Modified shot class to support caching of data better
* Modified shot class to walk the connection table starting from the master pseudoclock (currently only parses the masterpseudoclock and direct output channels on the master pseudoclock)

Modified the resampling algorithm:
* Resampling algorithm uses float64 (double) for added precision
* Resampling algorithm should preserve features on both sides of sample points
* Added Python version of resamling algorithm (__resample4 in main.pyw)

values.message:
Many improements to runviewer

Runviewer improvements:
 * Newly added channels appended to treeview in alphabetical order
 * Add empty datasets to initial plots, So that we don't plot massive amounts of data just before the resampling occurs.
 * Fixed issues where resample time range was in pixels, not in time units
 * modified resampling algorithm to have additional points for max/min feature. Number of time points should be one more than a multiple of three (one point for current value, one point for min, one point for max...repeated + final point).
 * Modified shot class to support caching of data better
 * Modified shot class to walk the connection table starting from the master pseudoclock (currently only parses the masterpseudoclock and direct output channels on the master pseudoclock)

Modified the resampling algorithm:
 * Resampling algorithm uses float64 (double) for added precision
 * Resampling algorithm should preserve features on both sides of sample points
 * Added Python version of resamling algorithm (__resample4 in main.pyw)

Added setup.py file to build c extension

message.raw:
Added lots of functionality

* Actual shots (h5 files) can be loaded now
* Resampling algorithm is in use for speed
* If the master pseudoclock is a PulseBlaster, the pulseblaster channels will have traces (requires labscript_devices module which will be added to bitbucket soon).

message.raw:
Implemented correct plot auto-ranging and reset controls

Plots will now auto-scale when adding/removing a shot if they were already set to autoscale.
If the plot has been manipulated in one or more axes, the appropriate axis scale will not update when adding/removing shots
Two buttons have been added to reset the auto-range.

If the plot has been manipulated in one or more axes, the appropriate axis scale will not update when adding/removing shots
Two buttons have been added to reset the auto-range.
